Q_DESC:
A positive rational number is a real number which can be expressed as P/Q where P, Q are co-prime positive integers. The Anderson is very hungry and can get chocolate only if he solves the following question. "Given a number N, find the number of positive rational numbers less than 1 such that when expressed as P/Q, both P, Q are less than or equal to N". Please help the Anderson in answering this question. The Anderson promises to share the chocolate with you.

Input

The first line contain a single integer T, the number of test cases. Following T (<= 1000) lines will contain a test case, a single number N (<= 1000000).

Output

For each test case print the output on a single line.
